DiseaseName.Name: Meningitis
DiseaseName.Description: In this disease, Inflammation occurs in the meninges of the brain, Piamater, Duramater and Spinal cord.
DiseaseName.Etiology: Etiology In newborns, it is caused by infection with gram-negative bacilli, such as E.coli, Proteus, Group B Streptococci A child who is too young and not yet fit to go to school is caused by Haemophilus influenzae, Neisserias meningitidis and streptococcus pneumoniae infection In adults, infection is caused by Neisseria meningitidis and streptococcus pneumoniae Viral Hepatitis Herpes simplex Venereal disease, in which the lymph nodes in the inguinal area become enlarged and ulcerated. This disease is called lymphogranuloma venereum From Varicella zoster virus Amoebiasis Trichinosis The diseases that humans get from domestic animals are called Trypanosomiasis</ EtiologyLineItem> Rheumatism Influenza T.B Syphilis Plague Measles Smallpox Sun protection Fire protection Heavy exercise Excessive consumption of Hot Food
DiseaseName.ClinicalFeatures: Clinical Features There is severe headache mostly in the occipital region</ ClinicalFeaturesLineItem> Fever Loss of appetite Hates light and noise Delirium The patient retracts his head to the side which is having pain</ ClinicalFeaturesLineItem> Convulsions in extremeties Coma In the beginning, Tuberculous lesions are formed in Tuberculous meningitis </ ClinicalFeaturesLineItem> Cerebro spinal fever, Meningococcal meningitis occurs suddenly, it spreads in the form of epidemic In this, Petechial rash occurs, that is why it is also called Spotted fever</ ClinicalFeaturesLineItem> Pneumonia, pneumococcal otitis media, osteomyelitis of skull, mastoiditis, chronic sinus infection, etc. are seen in Pneumococcal meningitis Like Polio encephalitis in Viral Meningitis, Cerebrospinal fluid changes</ ClinicalFeaturesLineItem> Sleep disappears From time to time, the patient has seizures The patient grinds his teeth The eyes are red It causes retention of urine The urine and the stool is emitted without intention The hands and the feet cool down The face becomes pale The face is covered with death Breathing comes with snoring There is neck pain Photophobia occurs Lethargy will happen Drowsiness
DiseaseName.Diagnosis:
Diagnosis Cloudy tubrid on examination of CSF in bacterial meningitis. It contains about 1000 Neutrophils/mm. Protein content is high, but sugar content is low. Causative organisms can be identified in Gram film. CSF in tuberculous meningitis is clear and clotted Lymphocytes are the most abundant in it, around 400 cells/m. Protein contents are high while the sugar content is low.</ DiagnosisLineItem>
Investigations Lumbar puncture with examination of the CSF Tuberculin test, PCR for tuberculin Malaria test Pneumococcal antigen Blood cultures

DiseaseName.Name: Vertigo
DiseaseName.Description: In this disease, the patient feels the objects around him moving. Sometimes he feels his limbs moving. Due to Equilibratory Disturbances, the patient is not able to stand and sit.
DiseaseName.Etiology: Etiology Migraine Brain Tumour Apoplexy Epilepsy Brain Haemorrhage Middle ear disease Tobacco Chewing Alcoholism Toxicity of salicylates Toxicity of streptomycin Sunstroke Food poisoning Menorrhagia Metrorrhagia More study Hyper coitus Infectious Disease
DiseaseName.Symptoms: Symptoms Nausea Vomiting Tinnitus Diplopia Syncope
DiseaseName.Signs: Signs Deafness Ataxia Head feels warm to touch The face and eyes are red The patient closes eyes with force

DiseaseGroup.Etiology: Etiology Hypertension Encephalitis Brain tumour Hydrocephalus Epilepsy Apoplexy Hysteria Convulsions Sun stroke Neural weakness Infection Coryza (Catarrh) Diarrhoea Intestinal worm Toxicity of opium Alcoholism Co poisoning CO2 poisoning Atropine poisoning Morphine poisoning Diabetes mellitus Retention of urine Uraemia Starvation Cold stroke Sadness Heavy Exercise Anaemia Metabolic disturbance Congenital Weakness Hypoglycemia
DiseaseGroup.ClinicalFeatures:
Clinical Features
Symptoms Bleeding from nose and ear in case of Brain Haemorrhage Hemiplegia Hypertension Neck rigidity Papilloedema Discharge of pus from nose and ear Fever Convulsions Dehydration Twitching retinopathy Proteinuria Acetone smell Ketonuria Glycosuria Central cyanosis Jaundice, icterus Splenomegaly Haematemesis Puffy face Dry skin Bradycardia Low Temperature Pinpoint pupils

DiseaseName.Name: Epilepsy
DiseaseName.Description: It is a Paroxysmal disease. In which the patient faints and usually falls on the ground with a thump and Convulsion occurs in his voluntary muscles and there are irregular movements.
DiseaseName.Etiology: Etiology Increased intracranial pressure Brain tumour Hydrocephalus Subarachnoid haemorrhage Meningitis Encephalitis Neurosyphilis Intracranial haemorrhage Head injuries Cerebral Atheroma Thrombosis Embolism Hypertensive Encephalopathy Stoke's Adam’s Syndrome Diffuse sclerosis Lipidosis Cerebral diplejía Porencephaly Tuberous sclerosis Poisoning of alcohol Cocaine poisoning Lead poisoning Arsenic poisoning Camphor poisoning Eclampsia Uraemia Hypoglycemia Hypocalcemia Anoxaemia Dyspnoea or asphyxia Co poisoning Teething Rickets Pyridoxine Deficiency Intestinal worm Sadness Excessive coitus Maturbation Excessive mental work Gout M.C. disturbances Heredity
DiseaseName.AgeCauses:
Age Causes
Infants Hypoxia, metabolic disorders, infections.
Adolescents Trauma, alcohol, drugs, infection, tumour, metabolic
Elderly Cerebrovascular, degenerative, tumour.
DiseaseName.Triggers: Triggers Sleep Deprivation Emotional Stress Physical and mental exhaustion Infection Fever Flickering light Proximity to television Noise (rare) Bathing with hot water (rare) Music (rare) Reading (rare)
DiseaseName.Symptoms:
Symptoms
Aura Headache Lethargy The patient sees circles of different colours. A special kind of smell and a scary figure appears. Sparks are seen flying in front of the eyes. Insomnia Pain is felt on the Epigastrium
Cry The patient falls on the ground with a scream. Tonic Spasm comes from respiratory muscles. A Grunting cry is heard.
Tonic Stage It causes stiffness in the muscles of the whole body. The Hands and jaws are tied. Cyanosis and accumulation of blood in the throat vein occurs on failure of breath. This state lasts for about half a minute.
Clonic Stage The movement of the hands and feet finishes. During the attack, the patient chews the teeth (champing movement), due to which the tongue gets cut into the teeth. Foam comes out from the mouth. Saliva appears on the lips. During this attack, there is retention of urine or incontinence of urine. Sometimes, stool is also released. This interval lasts for about three minutes.
PostEpilepticPhenomena Coma occurs for a short period during which the ligaments become loose. Pupil becomes dilated. Corneal Reflexes are lost. The temperature is slightly elevated. After Coma, the patient falls asleep and then wakes up several hours later. When he wakes up, he has a headache. The patient runs, runs and undresses.
DiseaseName.Diagnosis: Diagnosis Make detailed inquiries about the patient. Find out from the person who witnessed the patient's attack. Ask the patient the following questions: When does an epileptic attack occur? Does he have complete sleep or not? Has the patient not used any medicine that caused this seizure? This attack is not due to alcoholism? When the patient sits down to watch TV, the disease does not occur at that time? Epilepsy attacks during the day or at night? If there is Atura, how long is its interval? What causes stiffness in the hands and feet? What causes excessive salivation (Hypersalivation)? Does Cyanosis occur? The tongue is not cut during the attack? Is there retention of urine or incontinence of urine? Is there Limb pain, headache and drowsiness in the surroundings?
DiseaseName.GeneralExamination: GeneralExamination Pulse Blood pressure There is no trauma on the head. There are epiloia lesions on the skin. Neurofibromatosis Phenytoin therapy causes hyperplasia in the gums.
DiseaseName.Investigations: Investigations DLC, TLC, ESR Blood urea, Electrolytes, Calcium, Glucose LFT(Liver function tests) Serological tests for syphilis HIV serology in high risk groups. X-rays of the chest and skull. ECG(Electrocardiogram) EEg(Electroencephalography) Routine EEG 24 hour ambulatory EEG/ECG Video/EEG monitoring CT(Computed tomography) MRI(Magnetic Resonance imaging)
